reference.shortdesc: The equation-number element indicates that a block equation is numbered. It optionally specifies the number to use for the block equation.

section.title: Usage information
section.p: In normal usage, a block equation has a single number. However, the equation-number element can occur multiple times within the equation-block element. This enables the use of numbers with different (and exclusive) conditional properties.
When the equation-figure element contains content, the content of the element should be the number value without any surrounding punctuation, for example, 3.2a rather than (3.2a).

section.title: Rendering expectations
section.p: In this context, white-space content is considered equivalent to empty content. When the equation-number element has empty content, the equation number SHOULD be generated. When the equation-number element is not empty, the content SHOULD be used as the equation number. Processors MAY add punctuation or decoration to the number.

The details of equation numbering and number presentation are processor-specific. A common practice is to present the equation number to the right of the equation, centered vertically within the vertical extent of the block equation.

section.title: Specialization hierarchy
section.p: The equation-number element is specialized from ph. It is defined in the equation domain module.

example.title: Examples
example.p: This section contains examples of how the equation-number element can be used:

fig.title: An equation where the number will be generated
fig.p: The following code sample shows how an equation-number element can be used to indicate to a processor that an equation number should be auto-generated:
fig.codeblock: <equation-block id="eq-001"> <equation-number/> <image keyref="equation-image-01"> <alt>a squared plus b squared.</alt> </image> </equation-block>

fig.title: An equation where the equation number is explicitly specified

example.p: The following code sample shows how an equation-number element can specify the value for an equation number:
example.codeblock: <equation-block id="eq-3.2a"> <equation-number>3.2a</equation-number> <image keyref="equation-image-01"> <alt>a squared plus b squared.</alt> </image> </equation-block>
